fields.description:
This is almost identical to an earlier request: JRASERVER-17783 on which there is a "goodbye and goodnight" note dated April 2015, yet which somehow remains open.

Rather than just posting a comment to that previous issue, I'm opening a new one in an attempt to highlight that this remains an important theme. 

I am in a team of two that manages hundreds of filters, yet any given filter can only be managed by one of us. This is phenomenally inefficient. We need all designated users to be able to manage these filters; that means both of us, plus designated frontline users of each filter.

Ideally both multiple users AND groups could be assigned as owners of a filter. If we had to choose between multiple users OR groups we would prefer multiple users as that allows us to achieve instant granularity on a case-by-case basis without have to create a group each time. 

Please give this request serious consideration. It is essential to allow efficient management of JIRA at scale.
fields.summary: Allow filters to be edited by multiple users or by a group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Wiki markup is being unexpectedly included when exporting issues to HTML.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Edit an issue description to include wiki markup (e.g, color tagging).
Example:
{code}
{color:#59afe1}Text{color}
{code}
* In Issue Navigator, choose *List View* and add the *Description* column.
* Export -> HTML (Current Fields)

h3. Expected Results
Wiki markup has no semantic meaning outside of JIRA and thus should be removed from the exported data.

h3. Actual Results
Markup is included in the exported data in the description column, making the data difficult to read.

h3.Workaround
No workaround besides manually removing wiki markup prior to export.
fields.summary: Wiki markup unexpectedly included in HTML export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA crashed running out of Tomcat threads.
All threads are held waiting for Gadget feed read and JIRA freezes.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA integration with external applications: eg: Confluence, Bamboo
 * Gadget feed subscription exists from JIRA gadgets to get feeds from the external apps.
 * Issues noticed within the connection between JIRA and the other apps, or if the other apps are having a performance issue or are not available.

h3. Expected Results
 * If JIRA Gadget is not able to connect, it should timeout and the threads are no longer in waiting state

h3. Actual Results

Threads are stuck for ever and no timeout is happening, check below thread dump:
{noformat}
http-nio-8080-exec-150" #1556 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f614c1cb000 nid=0xe86f waiting on condition [0x00007f60c63f9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
        at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
        - parking to wait for  <0x00000006caab42f0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
        at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.Mutex.acquire(Mutex.java:45)
        at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.HTTPCache.doCachedRequest(HTTPCache.java:103)
        at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.HTTPCache.doCachedRequest(HTTPCache.java:80)
        at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.GadgetFeedReaderImpl.<init>(GadgetFeedReaderImpl.java:43)
        at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.GadgetFeedReaderFactoryImpl.getFeedReader(GadgetFeedReaderFactoryImpl.java:28)
{noformat}
Eventually all Tomcat threads are waiting and JIRA crashes.
Also many of the following warnings are thrown in the logs:
{noformat}
017-08-28 11:45:43,632 http-nio-8080-exec-483 WARN emp001627 705x16673608x10 vq636g 10.10.17.132,127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr [c.a.g.directory.internal.GadgetFeedsSpecProvider] Unable to parse feed from: http://<HOSTNAME>:<Port>/bamboo/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Effort should be made to address the Confluence or Bamboo unavailability problem as that is the trigger for this bug. In the short term, the offending gadget feed may be temporarily removed from JIRA gadget configuration.
fields.summary: JIRA crashes running out of Tomcat Threads due to broken external gadget feeds

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Top menu dropdown (Projects, Issues and Dashboards) does not work in IE 11. It only shows a small shadow below when you click it.
[^ie11.png]

h3. Environment
IE 11 browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Upload a Word document
# Copy the browser URL and close the IE browser
# Reopen the IE browser
# Paste URL into address bar and login again
# Attempt to download the Word document
# Click on the top menu dropdown (Projects, Issues and Dashboards)

h3. Expected Behaviour

The dropdown menu will show the contents

h3. Actual Behaviour

It only shows a small shadow below the menu bar and doesn't display the options. 

h3. Notes
* Boards dropdown works
* Refreshing the browser fixes the issue
* Tested with IE 11.540.15063.0

h3. Workaround
Use a browser other than IE.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JavaScript error is shown when editing user picker field on a board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum/Kanban software development project
# Create a user picker field (multi user picker field is possible as well) and make it associated with the Create/Edit issue screen of the project
# Run re-index
# Create an issue on the project and set any value in the user picker field
# Open the board and select the issue
# Press _Edit_ button and open the Edit issue screen
# Focus on the user picker field

h3. Expected Results

We can edit the user picker field without any error.

h3. Actual Results

The following JavaScript error was show.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

This problem never happened on JIRA Server 7.3.x and the earlier versions.

h3.Workaround
# Press "Hide..." button and just ignore the error. You can edit the value in the field.
# We can still edit the value from normal issue page (not on the board).
fields.summary: JavaScript error is shown when editing user picker field on a board

h4. Summary
When a status has more transitions than the screen resolution can handle, users are not able to scroll the view the rest.

 !no scroll bar.png|thumbnail!

 !scrollbar 64.png|thumbnail! 

This impacts customers who have many transitions out of a status.

h4. To replicate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA project import creates duplicate entries in the label table of the SQL database
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a project in JIRA with at least 1 issue
 # Give this issue a label, in this case used example label called 'special'
 # After this label has been confirmed, go into SQL and run command:
{code:java}
select * from label where label='special'; 
{code}  - This will return a single entry for this one issue with this label
 # Now generate an [XML backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/backing-up-data-185729581.html#BackingUpData-UsingJIRA%27sXMLbackuputility]
 # Then go back to the JIRA issue, remove that label from the issue
 # Re-run SQL query, you should have 0 results
 # Then delete the entire project from this JIRA instance
 # then create a new project with the same project name/key as the previously delete project
 # Then use the project import tool to import that previously deleted project (using the XML backup you created)
 # After this is complete, run the SQL query again:
{code:java}
select * from label where label='special';  
{code}

h3. Expected Results

We expect to only find the single entry in this table for that single issue with that special label
h3. Actual Results

We actually find there are two entries in this table for that issue in regards to this single label. Not only that, but all labels that were imported as part of issues imported in this project import appear to have duplicate entries in the label table of the database. The ID column is incrementing and is unique, but there are multiple entries with the same issue value and the same label value that appear to be caused directly by this project import process.
h3. Notes
 * Note that the UI of JIRA only shows a single label for this issue. So there is not a problem that way.
 * But in cases where users are running SQL queries or other external reporting on their databases for this table, this is a problem because the project import appears to be creating duplicate data that will mess with reporting.
 * This was not the case in regards to project imports in JIRA 6.x versions. It appears that this is something new as of the 7.x line of project importing.

h3. Workaround

It might be possible to use some fancy SQL query to locate and remove the duplicates, but I'm not sure the specifics of how this could be done without risking data loss/integrity issues.
fields.summary: JIRA project import creates duplicate entries in the label table of the SQL database

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you try to configure "FishEye/Crucible integration into JIRA" and and select FishEye or Crucible integration only, the setting will not be respected. 

h3. Environment

* FishEye 4.4.1
* JIRA 7.3.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between a FishEye and Crucible instance
# Authenticate both into both applications
# Go to Administraiton > Application links > Click on the ellipses and select "Configure FishEye Server.
# Select either "FishEye integration only" or "Crucible integration only" and click update. 
# Go to a JIRA issue that has both commits and reviews from FishEye/Crucible. 
#  You will still see both Reviews and Commits in the development panel despite removing FishEye or Crucible. 

h3. Expected Results

If you disable Crucible integration, you should not see reviews in the development panel. Likewise, I wouldn't expect you should commits if you disable FishEye (I'm not sure what the intended behavior is here).
fields.summary: Integration Setup not honored for FishEye/Crucible

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the current upgrade process, there are no any internal validators or automated tools for integrity checkers related to the user data. For some reasons recommended basic smoke tests may not give the user a trustworthy confirmation that the upgrade process has finished successfully.
The data owner might need to be 100% sure that the JIRA upgrade didn’t damage any basic user data: issues and related history, comments, attachments, etc. comparing to pre- and post- upgrade state. Currently, it might be partially achieved by some random manual sanity tests but it's not efficient for bigger databases.

The specifics of stored data (e.g. medical or any other critical records) and connected existing regulations may require some built-in automated process of data comparison and generate reports related to pre- and post- any JIRA core-level activity (significant configuration or data model changes, upgrades, migrations etc). The customers are looking for a predefined level of guarantee of data integrity.
It will definitely help to speed up:
 * the post-upgrade data validation process
 * new customers on boarding process (for Premier Support)
 * may be a crucial feature for stakeholders for choosing a platform (especially on an enterprise level).

h3. Suggested Solution

A built-in on-demand administration level mechanism (integrity check) that will automatically revalidate and compare both the upgrade stages (or some other potential data-risky internal JIRA process): pre- and post- change. Functions that will generate a summarised report with additional information related to the process itself (incorporated changes, checked and validated records, found issues or errors etc.)
h3. Workaround

No workaround found.
fields.summary: As a data administrator I want to have an extra confidence that during the JIRA upgrade process the user data was intact

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The method updateCustomField(Long id, String name, String description, CustomFieldSearcher searcher)() mentioned in this [documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.2.0/com/atlassian/jira/issue/CustomFieldManager.html#updateCustomField-java.lang.Long-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.CustomFieldSearcher-] allows NULL values for the name parameter.

If this method is called by a script that passes a NULL value for the name parameter, a 500 error will be returned when accessing any page in JIRA except the admin section, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !500 error.png|thumbnail! 

For this reason, the method updateCustomField() should not allow null values.

h3. Why this is important



h3. Workaround

For now, the only workaround is to make sure that any script making a call to this function does not pass a NULL name.
fields.summary: Prevent the method updateCustomField() from accepting NULL values

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
One of major features of custom fields is to calculate its value based on another data. In some cases this calculation is based on Lucene search. 
It works fine when JIRA has valid Lucene. But it's broken during Full reindex, since there is no data in Lucene (catch22 problem). 

h3. Suggested Solution
Reindexing algorithm in JIRA should be changed and include 2 phases:
# JIRA should run normal reindex for all Custom Fields, except the _calculated_
# Then it should run additional reindex phase for all _calculated_  fields.

h3. Workaround 
# Disable the calculated Lucene dependent field (if some cases you can disable the search part only, eg ScriptRunner ScriptedFields see [jql_searches_in_script_fields|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/scripted-fields.html#_jql_searches_in_script_fields])
# Run full reindex 
# Enable the field 
# Run background re-index. (Please note that background will affect performance and heavily fragment Lucene)

Alternative Workaround:
Put JIra in safe mode, perform full re-index and run background re-index
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to have 2 phases reindexing for Calculated fields

fields.description:
Many of our projects use external forms like Forms for Confluence ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.adaptavist.confluence.formMailNG/cloud/overview)] to create JIRA issues, as much of the projects' required information can be pre-populated into the fields. 

It would be very helpful if we could enforce users to only create issues through those external sources on a per-project level.

There is currently no way to prevent users from these projects from creating issues directly through JIRA. It would be ideal if there was a project-level configuration to redirect users (or simply provide the link to click on) to an external page (a page with a Forms for Confluence form in this case) when the project is selected in the "Create Issue" dialog.
fields.summary: Allow redirect from "Create" issue dialog to external form

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Setting JIRA's context path to "/secure" breaks several icons and images
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the context path to "/secure" on the server.xml file
 # Restart JIRA
 # Create a new project (might not be necessary) and new tickets

h3. Expected Results
 - JIRA works properly

h3. Actual Results
 - Several icons, such as the bug icon on issues, will be missing/broken
 - Nothing seems to be logged by JIRA

h3. Notes

The word 'secure' is already part of several JIRA links by default, and setting that context path to '/secure' causes the link to be generated with the word 'secure' twice, next to each other.
It seems that when the word 'secure' is used as a context path, JIRA ignores one of the 'secure' when generating some URLs, leading to broken links and images.
h3. Solution / Workaround
 - Use another context path.
fields.summary: Setting JIRA's context path to "/secure" breaks several icons and images

1
_null_

h4. Actual Result

_null_
2
1

fields.summary: JQL "ORDER BY Desc" place null at the highest order

!jira issue macro.png|thumbnail!
h4. Steps to replicate -
 # Set up JIRA as user management for Confluence
 # Create application link between JIRA and Confluence
 # Set the authentication as OAUTH (Impersonation)

 # View the Confluence page with the JIRA Macro issues

h4. Expected Results

Depending on application access/group access to the JIRA project, it should either show the issues with summary or show below if no permissions -

!permissions.jpg|thumbnail!
h4. Actual Results

With OAUTH (Impersonation) it shows the error -

h4. Workaround

Use OAUTH for application link, but this will mean users who have application access will need to authenticate to switch between the applications.

fields.description:
Admins need to be able to filter for users based on which Directory (LDAP vs Internal) a user belongs.

Please add ability for admins to filter on users by which directory the users belong to on the User Management (/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa) screen.

This would be helpful on +all+ Atlassian products with "User management" screens.
fields.summary: Add ability to filter Users by Directory
JQL search with 'WAS' operator throws error for inactive users who have never been assigned an issue

fields.description: One of our developers noticed that when using JIRA SD in Chrome that copying and pasting from Notepad ++ text that is monospaced it loses it formatting when pasting into comments section of a ticket when using the preformatted macro. A single line will format correctly but not a full table.
fields.summary: Chrome Monospace quirk

fields.description:
*Short overview*

For a setup with two connected JIRA instances, linked each other, the "Created vs Resolved Chart" gadget in a remote (external) and local mode contain settings pages with options named differently. It is difficult to compare or analyze related settings.

*Expected results*

Both gadgets (local and external) should contain similar settings pages and connected option names.

*Actual Results*

The settings pages look differently. See 
!gadget_external-local.png|thumbnail! 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Setup two JIRA nodes
 ## *jira1* and *jira2* with default sample setup.
 ## connect two nodes with each other by creating an application link:
 ### on *jira1*: Jira Administration -> Applications -> Application links, Configure Application Links: [http://jira2:8080|http://jira2:8080/]
 ### on *jira2*: Jira Administration -> Applications -> Application links, Configure Application Links: [http://jira1:8080|http://jira1:8080/]
 # Create the Dashboard:
 ## Dashboards -> Manage Dashboards -> Create New Dashboard
 # Create the gadget subscription:
 ## *jira1*: Add Gadget -> Manage Gadgets -> Subscription, Add a subscription: [http://jira2:8080|http://jira2:8080/]
 ## *jira2*: Add Gadget -> Manage Gadgets -> Subscription, Add a subscription: [http://jira1:8080|http://jira1:8080/]
 # Add *the local gadget* to the Dashboard:
 ## *jira1*: Dashboards -> Your dashboard name -> Add gadget -> Charts -> Created vs Resolved Chart (By Atlassian * Local)
 # Add *the external gadget* to the Dashboard
 ## *jira2*: Dashboards -> Your dashboard name -> Add gadget -> Load all gadgets -> Charts -> Created vs Resolved Chart (By Atlassian * Local)
 # Edit both gadgets to display settings pages.

*Workaround*
No workaround found.
fields.summary: "Created vs Resolved Chart" gadget, "local" and "external" settings pages are different

fields.description:
*Short overview*

For a setup with two connected JIRA instances, linked each other, the "Created vs Resolved Chart" gadget in a remote mode (external) rendered graphs, graph elements and description are using different templates and visual style than the local one. It is difficult to compare or analyze connected graphs.

*Expected results*

Both graphs (local and external) should be rendered identically with the same template and visual style.

*Actual Results*

The visual style is totally different, even for the same data used. See final_result.png

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Setup two JIRA nodes
 ## *jira1* and *jira2* with default sample setup.
 ## connect two nodes with each other by creating an application link:
 ### on *jira1*: Jira Administration -> Applications -> Application links, Configure Application Links: [http://jira2:8080|http://jira2:8080/]
 ### on *jira2*: Jira Administration -> Applications -> Application links, Configure Application Links: [http://jira1:8080|http://jira1:8080/]
 # Create the Dashboard:
 ## Dashboards -> Manage Dashboards -> Create New Dashboard
 # Create the gadget subscription:
 ## *jira1*: Add Gadget -> Manage Gadgets -> Subscription, Add a subscription: [http://jira2:8080|http://jira2:8080/]
 ## *jira2*: Add Gadget -> Manage Gadgets -> Subscription, Add a subscription: [http://jira1:8080|http://jira1:8080/]
 # Add *the local gadget* to the Dashboard:
 ## *jira1*: Dashboards -> Your dashboard name -> Add gadget -> Charts -> Created vs Resolved Chart (By Atlassian * Local)
 # Add *the external gadget* to the Dashboard
 ## *jira2*: Dashboards -> Your dashboard name -> Add gadget -> Load all gadgets -> Charts -> Created vs Resolved Chart (By Atlassian * Local)
 # Load or create some random data (create a few issues with different states: open, in progress, done etc)

*Workaround*
No workaround found.
fields.summary: "Created vs Resolved Chart" gadget visual style of the rendered graphs mismatch (local vs external)

fields.description:
*Short overview*
  
 For a setup with two connected JIRA instances, linked each other, the "Created vs Resolved Chart" gadget in a remote mode (external) renders graphs incorrectly with "Cumulative" option enabled. Displayed graph based on gathered data from a remote instance is not aligned with a related graph on a remote instance in a local mode.

*Expected results*

Based on exactly the same data both graphs should render identically.

*Actual Results*

The graph in a local mode displays data correctly, the gadget in a remote mode (external) is broken - the rendered graph is not aligned with the local one on a second JIRA node. See final_result.png

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Setup two JIRA nodes
 ## *jira1* and *jira2* with default sample setup.
 ## connect two nodes with each other by creating an application link:
 ### on *jira1*: Jira Administration -> Applications -> Application links, Configure Application Links: [http://jira2:8080|http://jira2:8080/]
 ### on *jira2*: Jira Administration -> Applications -> Application links, Configure Application Links: [http://jira1:8080|http://jira1:8080/]
 # Create the Dashboard:
 ## Dashboards -> Manage Dashboards -> Create New Dashboard
 # Create the gadget subscription:
 ## *jira1*: Add Gadget -> Manage Gadgets -> Subscription, Add a subscription: [http://jira2:8080|http://jira2:8080/]
 ## *jira2*: Add Gadget -> Manage Gadgets -> Subscription, Add a subscription: [http://jira1:8080|http://jira1:8080/]
 # Add *the local gadget* to the Dashboard:
 ## *jira1*: Dashboards -> Your dashboard name -> Add gadget -> Charts -> Created vs Resolved Chart (By Atlassian * Local)
 ## *jira1*: Edit gadget -> Collection Operation, set Cumulative
 # Add *the external gadget* to the Dashboard
 ## *jira2*: Dashboards -> Your dashboard name -> Add gadget -> Load all gadgets -> Charts -> Created vs Resolved Chart (By Atlassian * Local)
 ## *jira2*: Edit gadget -> Collection Operation, set Cumulative Totals: Yes
 # Load or create some random data (create a few issues with different states: open, in progress, done etc)

*Workaround*
 No workaround found.
fields.summary: "Created vs Resolved Chart" gadget in a remote mode renders graphs incorrectly for "Cumulative" option enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When printing attachment from below use case extra pages is added for any type of attachment:
# Printing from issue navigator
# Printing from project > issues pages
# Printing from project > queue page (only for service desk project)

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.4.3
* Service desk versison 3.6.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to print an attachment for an issue via issue navigator, or project > issues pages or project > queue page as shown in the screenshot below:

+issue navigator+
 !issue navigator.JPG|thumbnail! 

+project > issues pages+
 !software.JPG|thumbnail! 

+project > queue page+
 !service desk.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Attachment should be printed based on the number of page for the attachment.

h3. Actual Results
Extra pages are added for the attachment printing

h3.Workaround
Open the attachment in a new tab then you can print the attachment without issues.
fields.summary: Printing Attachment create extra pages for Certain Condition in JIRA

fields.description:
We have JIRA and Confluence connected using the same User base.
 # There is a restricted Confluence page
 # JIRA issue is mentioned there
 # persons not having access to Confluence page get  a message: "Page failed to load" with a running spinner.

It would be nicer, that there is either a message, that issue is mentioned on a page, you do not have access to, or you get no message at all.
fields.summary: Better display of linked confluence page you have no access to

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the attached email is forwarded to the JIRA mail handler account, the email is processed as a new ticket/update, but the image does not get uploaded as an attachment. It is clearly being skipped with a reason of "Attachment detected as JIRA generated attachment," but this doesn't appear to be the case
h3. Environment

Reproduced in 7.2(customer version) and 7.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Forward the attached email to a Core/Software mail handler account (for security reasons, this is permissioned internally)
h3. Expected Results

The image should be added as an attachment, not skipped.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the DEBUG atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log file:
{noformat}
2017-08-24 15:50:18,615 DEBUG [gmail-in] Caesium-1-3 anonymous    gmail-handler Attachment detected as JIRA generated attachment - skipping.
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The following explanation for the criteria of an image to be considered a "JIRA generated attachment" was provided by Engineering:
{panel}
Basically, if a picture satisifes the following conditions:
 * Metadata Content-Id starts with "<jira-generated-image-"
OR
 * Is a PNG image
 * and has PNG keyword set: "jira-system-image-type"{panel}
 
h3. Workaround

open and save the image as a JPEG in Paint or Gimp, then resend.
fields.summary: Attached image file skipped when sent via email

fields.description: When you are logged as a system administrator who belongs to an external LDAP you are not able to see all the configuration details of your directory. For administrator purposes, we need to be able to READ (we understand that edit the current user directory is not an option in order to avoid authentication/access issues) all user directories configuration details.
fields.summary: Ability to ALWAYS see the user directory configuration details

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the options add user/groups/project role to an issue security scheme gives you the option to only add user/groups/project role without the ability to logic which is possible with JQL like:
Example:

Add level,select Group "HR" AND Group "IT"/

if user add to group "HR " and group "IT" , then user view this issue.
if user add to group "HR" or group "IT" then user not view this issue

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to specify the user/groups/project role using logic in JQL
fields.summary: As a admin, I would like to set the users for issue security based on JQL

fields.description: When closing an issue as a duplicate of some other issue the votes and watchers of the dup issue should be added to that other issue automatically.
fields.summary: For duplicate issues move votes and watchers to the original issue.

fields.description: It would be useful if the sprint cards showed the pull request status. As a team, we'd see if something is waiting with an open request, and when individually looking for the next issue to pick up, we could consider something with an open PR first.
fields.summary: Show Pull Request status on cards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA attachment preview doesn't show digital signature in a PDF file.

h3. Environment
* Reproduced in JIRA 7.2.3, 7.2.4 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a PDF with digital signature to an issue (Sample PDF:  [^SampleSignedPDFDocument.pdf] )
# Click on the PDF to open it in preview

h3. Expected Results
You see the pdf contents and the digital signature

h3. Actual Results
You see the PDF content without the digital signature
 
h3. Notes
* Simalar to issue in confluence:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43353
fields.summary: Digital signature in PDF is not visible when previewed in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to clone an issue that contains required fields, JIRA displays a generic workflow error instead of the required fields message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a trial of the "[Scripting Suite Pro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.quisapps.jira.jsspro/server/overview]" plugin or any other plugin that has a workflow validator for fields;
 # Create a test project;
 # Create a dummy issue in the project;
 # Edit the project workflow and add a "Jython Validator" function on the Create transition with the following inline script:
 ----------------
 invalid_fields = \{}
 invalid_fields["Summary"] = "must have proper summary"
 description = "Failed validation test"
 result = False
 ------------
 # Publish the workflow.
 # Attempt to clone the dummy issue created

h3. Expected Results

In JIRA 7.1.x, the error is nicely formatted:

!jira7.1.0.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

In JIRA 7.2.x, a generic workflow message is displayed:

!jira7.2.4.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue that contains required field displays a generic workflow error instead of the required fields message.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According to [Anonymising JIRA Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/anonymising-jira-data-139008.html] currently the JIRA Data anonymizer can only anonymize following information :
* Issue summary, environment, and description.
* Comments, work logs, change logs.
* Project descriptions.
* Descriptions for most elements (notification schemes, permission schemes, resolutions).
* Attachment file names.
* "Unlimited text" custom fields.

Sometime customer also wants to anonymize user related information like user name and email address.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the Anonymizer to anonymize also user name and email address.
fields.summary: Allow data anonymizer to anonymize user name and email addresses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a panel/code etc. markup with parameters in a table any modification made in Visual mode cannot be saved, the modification doesn't get reflected when switching to the Text mode neither.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure Rich Text Editor is enabled.
# Create a comment in Visual mode : first inserting a table then inserting a panel in one of the table cells.
# Switch to Text mode and add a parameter to the panel markup. For example, set a background color with {{|bgColor=Peru}}
# Switch back to Visual mode and make some modifications in the comment
# Save the comment

h3. Expected Results
Comment should be saved as displayed in step 4.

h3. Actual Results
All the modifications made in step 4 after adding the parameter in the panel markup are lost.

h3.Workaround
Use Text mode to edit comment
fields.summary: Modification made in visual mode can't be saved when using panel with parameters in a table

fields.description:
*+Problem Definition+*
 Activity Stream Gadget causing high memory/CPU consumption when there is 1 million+ of records in the AO_563AEE_ACTIVITY_ENTITY table.

In this particular case, found that majority of these records are from 3rd party plugins (Insight). However, do note that this can happen to any plugins so long you have large amount of data in the mentioned table.

And also, even after we have filtered off everything using the Global Filter, accessing the Filter configuration still does a check on the table which causes the high memory/CPU.

*+Suggested Solution+*
 # Current design, once the Activity Stream Gadget is added it will load all records before you can access to the filter configuration and configure the necessary filter. *Propose* to first show the filter configuration screen before loading the data, this will allow user to configure the data returned.
 # And also, once filtered off everything accessing the filter configuration will still cause high CPU/memory consumption as it seems that below SQL is triggered upon clicking on filter configuration. *Propose* to review the code if is necessary to trigger the SQL query while loading the filter configuration,
{code:java}
2017-08-16 20:25:38,209 StreamsCompletionService::thread-36 DEBUG xxxxxx 1225x624x1 15efyoj 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/activity-stream/1.0/config [n.java.ao.sql] SELECT PUBLISHED,URL,TITLE,GENERATOR_ID,USERNAME,ISSUE_KEY,GENERATOR_DISPLAY_NAME,CONTENT,ID,ACTIVITY_ID,PROJECT_KEY,POSTER,VERB FROM AO_563AEE_ACTIVITY_ENTITY
{code}
 

*+Why this is important+*
With current design, this will cause high CPU/memory consumption which will halt the system eventually. A restart would be require to fix the slowness.

+*Workaround*+
 Review the records in the AO_563AEE_ACTIVITY_ENTITY table. Delete old or unwanted data. You can run the following queries to check the records and delete accordingly.
 # Check how many records and the respective plugins.
{code:java}
SELECT GENERATOR_DISPLAY_NAME as Plugin, count(ACTIVITY_ID) as ID FROM AO_563AEE_ACTIVITY_ENTITY group by Plugin{code}

{code:java}
SELECT year(published) as year, count(ACTIVITY_ID) as ID FROM AO_563AEE_ACTIVITY_ENTITY group by year
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Next run time shown for 'com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraService:10000' under Scheduler Administration is incorrect (it shows the time JIRA approximately starts up) and does not update.

Note: 'com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraService:10000' refers to the Mail Queue Service 'com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService'.


h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.0.5
* JIRA Server 7.2.8
* JIRA Server 7.3.7
* JIRA Server 7.4.0
* JIRA Server 7.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Go to Scheduler Administration (under _System -> Scheduler details_)
# Click 'Show more' for 'com.atlassian.jira.service.DefaultServiceManager'
# Take note of Last run and Next run time/date for 'com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraService:10000'
# Wait for a minute, and then refresh the page and check the time/date again

h3. Expected Results
The Next run time should be later than the Last run time for 'com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraService:10000'. The cron time used for scheduling is '0 * * * * ?', and as such there should be a minute's interval between the Last run time and Next run time.


h3. Actual Results
The Next run time stays the same while the Last run time gets updated every minute. Next run time appears to show the time that JIRA instance started and it does not change.

h3. Impact
Since the Last run time does get updated every minute, it means that the Scheduler is working as expected. Therefore, the impact of this bug is *Low*.

h3.Workaround
None yet
fields.summary: Next run date/time shown in 'com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraService:10000' scheduler is incorrect

fields.description:

fields.description:
I have no complaint with the single strikethrough that JIRA uses to indicate that an issue has been resolved. But when looking at tickets assigned to QA in our team, we cannot easily distinguish between those resolved (ready for QA) and those that have completed QA (closed).

Add a double strikethrough text decoration for issues in Done or Closed status.
fields.summary: Use double-strikethrough to differentiate closed issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5783].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 20 July 2016}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

The Field Required Validator for workflow transitions *has been incorporated into JIRA Cloud* as a native feature. For JIRA Cloud customers, we recommend using this validator as the most direct way to resolve this use case.

For *JIRA Server* customers, the validator is still available by installing the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin, which is [free and available on the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities/server/overview].

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.

Regards,
 Dave Meyer
 dmeyer@atlassian.com
 Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
*Original request description:*

The reporter can not add an issue when he has no resolve permissions and the "fixed Version" field is a required field.

As a JIRA Administrator I want a "Fixed version" to be a required field when resolving. But it seems illogical that someone reporting an issue should enter the field. This applies to other fields as well.
h3. Workaround

The [JIRA Suite Utilities|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities] provides a [fields required validator|https://jsutil.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JSUTIL/JIRA+Suite+Utilities+Workflow+Validators#JIRASuiteUtilitiesWorkflowValidators-FieldsRequiredValidator] that can be configured to set fields required on specific transitions.
fields.summary: Make field required only for one state transition

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

On high load the NodeReindexServiceThread can fail acquiring the READ lock with the following error. However, it is not saying what thread/process holding the lock


{noformat}
2017-07-23 00:15:10,552 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 millis
econds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:824)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.access$600(DefaultIndexManager.java:90)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$IndexLock.tryLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:1166)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:810)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.deIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:763)
        ... 2 filtered
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy16.deIndexIssueObjects(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateIssueIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:410)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateAffectedIndexes(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:298)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:252)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.dt_access$778(DefaultNodeReindexService.java)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) 
{noformat}

Read Lock - DefaultIndexManager

{code:borderStyle=solid}
        /**
         * The index read lock. This lock needs to be acquired when updating the index (i.e. adding to it or updating
         * existing documents in the index).
         */
        final IndexLock readLock = new IndexLock(indexLock.readLock()); 
{code}

*Suggested Solution*

* Log debugging information when DefaultIndexManager failed to acquire the READ lock.

Workaround

* None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to have debug logging for DefaultIndexManager lock (readLock)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Free Space Health check uses common-io library to calculate the size of the index directory, to verify there is enough free space for indexing. Due to a bug in the library, [IO-389|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-389], this can cause the check to fail if a file is deleted whilst the check is running. We use commons-io 1.4 in the plugin.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a large index dir setup
# Run the health check
# Delete a lucene segment file during the check

h3. Expected Results

The check can continue without problems

h3. Actual Results

An exception is thrown as below:

{code}
2017-08-08 15:01:00,082 SupportHealthCheckThread-7 ERROR      [c.a.j.p.healthcheck.support.AbstractSupportHealthCheck] Unhandled error during healthcheck
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: /export/apps/jira/jira_data_7210/caches/indexes/issues/_7fsrj.tis does not exist
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.sizeOf(FileUtils.java:2053)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory(FileUtils.java:2089)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.sizeOf(FileUtils.java:2057)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory(FileUtils.java:2089)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.util.CachedDirectorySizeEstimator.sizeOfFile(CachedDirectorySizeEstimator.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.StorageIndexSnapshotHealthCheck.checkFreeDiskSpaceForIndex(StorageIndexSnapshotHealthCheck.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.StorageIndexSnapshotHealthCheck.doCheck(StorageIndexSnapshotHealthCheck.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.AbstractSupportHealthCheck.check(AbstractSupportHealthCheck.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.check(PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckCallable.call(HealthCheckCallable.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckCallable.call(HealthCheckCallable.java:15)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Browse to *Manage add-ons*
# Expand the *Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Instance Health Plugin* plugin
# Click + next to "n of n modules enabled"
# Search for "storageIndexSnapshotHealthCheck"
# Mouse-over it and click Disable.
fields.summary: Free Space Health check fails due to an IllegalArgumentException

fields.description:

Attached are thread dumps taken from a large JIRA instance while deleting a version to demonstrate the length of time needed. On busier instances this effect is more pronounced.
fields.summary: Deleting versions in large JIRA instances takes minutes to complete with no progress reported

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a JIRA Data Center Environment, ClassNotFoundException can be seen in the logs due to the DVCS Connector initializing JIRA Data Center cache with its own classloader. This causes exceptions during removal operations from {{com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.usersCache}} and can break replication across nodes. 


h3. Environment

* JIRA Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup JIRA Data Center with at least 2 nodes.
# Observe the logs 

h3. Expected Results

Cache replicates. 

h3. Actual Results

* The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file of healthy node:
{code}
ehcache-replicator-19 ERROR      [c.a.j.c.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator] Exception on replication of remove. RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
    	java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
    	java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator$UserKey (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled). Cache: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.usersCache Peer: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.usersCache
java.rmi.ServerException: RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
	java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
	java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator$UserKey (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled)
{code}
fields.summary: DVCS Connector initializes Data Center with wrong class loader and breaks cache replication

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When users paste screenshots in comments or in the description from a JIRA issue, the user will get different results if he's on Text mode and if he's on Visual mode.

If the user attaches the screenshot on Text mode, it will attach the file and insert a thumbnail of the image in the comment/description.
If the users attached the screenshot on Visual mode, it will attach the image in its regular size.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a JIRA issue
# Click to edit the description from the issue
# Copy and paste an image while in Visual Mode

h3. Expected Results

The image will be attached to the ticket and a thumbnail will be added to the description.

h3. Actual Results

The image will be attached to the ticket and the image will be added to the description in its normal size. 

h3. Workaround

To make the image displayed as a thumbnail, re-edit the description and wrap the file name as follows: 
{code:none} 
!image.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
fields.summary: Pasting screenshots in Text mode vs Visual mode causes different results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When viewing a Knowledge base article, it shows an empty content.

h3. Environment
# Both applications must use a different domain in order to reproduce the issue. As an example:
#* JIRA - "anna.cardino.com"
#* Confluence - "monique.cardino.com"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure proxy to JIRA and Confluence following [Integrating JIRA with Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/integrating-jira-with-apache-720411718.html]
# Add this parameter to the VirtualHost file of JIRA and Confluence 
{code}
Header always append X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN
{code}
# Ensure that JIRA and Confluence are using different domain nama else, the issue won't be reproducible.
# Create an application link with OAuth Impersonation configured on Outgoing and Incoming
# Create a Service Desk project and link it to one of the Confluence spaces.
# Go to the Service Desk project and raise a request
# On the *What do you need help with?* field, type the title of the pages on the linked Space.
# Search works fine as per the [^search.png]
# Click on the title link

h3. Expected behaviour
The page will display it's content

h3. Actual Behaviour
It shows an empty content [^empty.png]

h3. Notes
Removing the header parameter in the VirtualHost file fixes the problem. However, it is not advisable due to security risk. It was also mentioned as a workaround in [JRASERVER-25143|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25143]

h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base in JIRA Service Desk does not show the Content when "Header always append X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN" is added on the VirtualHost file

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The project type can be converted easily by changing the project type directly via the project settings > Details. However, there are a lot of unexpected changes (due to lack of documentation) which admins or the user in action should be acknowledged and guided through the process. In some cases, admin unknowingly changing the project type of a project with shared schemes, resulting in unwanted problems.

h3. Suggestion
A migration wizard to guide the admin through the project type conversion progress. It should explain what exactly will be changed, added or removed, allow some of it to be configured during the conversion, and to confirm if the project type should be converted as the last step.

h3. Why is it important
* More flexible options on converting a project type
* To remind the user in action on the expected outcome, especially if the project is using any shared schemes with other projects
fields.summary: Project type conversion/migration wizard

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The current documentation of [Convert a project type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/defining-a-project-881683385.html#Definingaproject-convertConvertaprojecttype] does not provide details on what is expected to happen to the existing project after the project type conversion. Admins would like to know what are the changes to the associated schemes e.g. fields, screens and etc.

h3. Suggestion
Improve the current documentation of [Convert a project type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/defining-a-project-881683385.html#Definingaproject-convertConvertaprojecttype] to include all the expected changes based on scenarios i.e. Business/Software project to Service Desk project and vice versa.

h3. Why is it important
* To clarify the changes on the project settings after the conversion
* To set the expectations on what will be changed and what will not be changed, it also helps admins to plan the tasks ahead
fields.summary: Documentation for details on converting project type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are able to view, log in and perform actions (Eg. Create issue, search) in JIRA even though a Lock re-index is occurring.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.4.0
* JIRA Server 7.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a Lock re-index on JIRA
# While JIRA performs the re-index, open a new browser window and access JIRA.
# Log in as a different user.

h3. Expected Results
Users are supposed to see a 'JIRA access problem' message only

h3. Actual Results
Users are able to view, access and perform actions in JIRA. If users perform an action during the re-index, the following error below may appear in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}
[c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:824)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.access$600(DefaultIndexManager.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$IndexLock.tryLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:1166)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:810)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
There is no workaround as of yet.
fields.summary: Users able to access JIRA while Lock re-index is occurring

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Certain combinations of text in tables can cause table header cells to wrap vertically in issue view, when the table is present in an editable field (i.e, such as the description field. Any field that has the {{editable}} CSS class produces this behaviour)

h3. Environment
This seems to only be reproducible in Webkit/Blink based browsers, such as Safari and Google Chrome. Firefox and IE do not seem to be affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add a large complex table to the description of the issue

h3. Expected Results
The table displays correctly, and the header cells are readable

h3. Actual Results
The header cells do not always display correctly and can wrap vertically.

h3.Workaround
Add the following CSS to [JIRA's announcement banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-an-announcement-banner-802592288.html]:

{code}
<style type="text/css">
.editable-field table.confluenceTable th {
	word-break: normal;	
}
</style>
{code}

Note that if a typo occurs, it may break access to JIRA (due to invalid or incomplete HTML). If you have problems immediately after adjusting the banner, you can [follow these steps to manually remove the banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-jira-announcement-banner-through-the-database-429916703.html].
fields.summary: Certain combinations of text can cause table headers to wrap awkwardly in editable fields in issue view

fields.description: It'd be nice to be able to toggle or collapse the integrations panels in JIRA issues. Right now there's no way to collapse or control or toggle the width of the panel.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to toggle or collapse the right side panel when in issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The watch count can be out of sync due to the autowatch feature when used in conjunction with comments on workflow transitions.  Users with autowatch enabled will be added as watchers when transitioning a workflow and commenting in the transition screen, but the count is not update in the *jiraissue* table

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable autowatch in your user profile if not already enabled
# Transition an issue you are not already a watcher on for a issue with a screen configured for the workflow transition
# Comment on the transition
# Attempt to remove all watchers 

h3. Expected Results
All watchers are removed without issue.

h3. Actual Results
All but one watcher is removed, the last watcher you attempt to remove will stay.

Same behaviour as the closed issue JRASERVER-45924.

Query will show 0 watches on *jiraissue*, but there are watchers in the *userassociation* table just like in JRASERVER-45924:

To find if an instance is affected, run the following query in the database that returns the amount of issues affected.
{noformat}
select count(*)
from (select count(*) as real_watchers_count, i.watches as issue_watches, i.id as issue_id from userassociation a left join jiraissue i on a.sink_node_id = i.id where association_type like 'WatchIssue' group by a.sink_node_id, i.id, i.watches) tt1 
where tt1.real_watchers_count > tt1.issue_watches;
{noformat}

To find which specific issues are affected:
{noformat}
select tt1.real_watchers_count, tt1.issue_watches, tt1.issue_id, (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) AS issue, i.summary
from jiraissue i inner join project p on i.project = p.id
inner join (select count(*) as real_watchers_count, i.watches as issue_watches, i.id as issue_id from userassociation a join jiraissue i on a.sink_node_id = i.id where association_type like 'WatchIssue' group by a.sink_node_id, i.id, i.watches) tt1 on tt1.issue_id = i.id
where tt1.real_watchers_count > tt1.issue_watches;
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

For individual issues, you can remove the last watcher by following these steps:
# Add your self as a watcher if you are not already a watcher
# Remove all other watchers
# Click on the number under "watchers" in the People side-panel
# Click the trash icon next to your user watcher (should be the only one)
# Close the watchers list popup
# Click start watching and stop watching until the number is 0 and the link is "start watching this issue"


This query syncs the counts back for all issues:
{noformat}
UPDATE jiraissue i set watches = (select count(*) from userassociation where association_type like 'WatchIssue' and sink_node_id = i.id);
{noformat}
on sites with many thousands of issues, this query may take a long time to complete. Do a DB backup before running.
fields.summary: Autowatch causes watch count to be out of sync after comment on workflow transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The "smart mentions" feature [introduced with JIRA 7.2.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-2-x-release-notes-826896227.html] only considers the following types of users as "involved":
 - the assignee
 - the reporter
 - the commenter(s)
 - the watcher(s)
 - the voter (s)

However, if a user has been mentioned in a comment but doesn't belong to any of the types mentioned above, such user (like a newly added Participant) won't be considered as "involved".
h3. Why this is important

It would be great if the "smart mentions" could also include users mentioned in a comment within the ticket, since such users are also involved in the ticket.
h3. Workaround
 * For now, the only workaround would be for any person mentioned in the ticket to comment in the ticket, so that they can be part of the list of "involved" users.
 * A second workaround is to add a Custom field of type User Picker Multiple, and use it to manually add users and trigger notifications for them (similar to the way watcher notifications are configured):
 *# Create a Custom field, with the Type _User Picker (Multiple Users)_ (see example [^image-2017-08-17-16-35-04-614.png]).
 *# Add the custom field to the screens you need (in my example, the field is called 'Participants' and I added it to all my existent screens [^image-2017-08-17-16-37-57-605.png]).
 *# You can decide what events will be notified to the users included in the 'Participants' custom field by going to the Project settings, Notifications section, and _Edit_ the current Notification scheme of the project, click the _Add_ link of the desired event, selecting the option "User Custom Field Value", and select your custom field ('Participants' in my example [^image-2017-08-17-21-42-12-852.png]).
 *# Now you will be able to use your custom field and mention as many users as required, applying the same rules to mentions described before, and they will appear on the right side of the issue view (see example [^image-2017-08-17-21-49-27-417.png]). 
*#* While the field is empty, it will not be shown, but you can Edit the issue to add 'participants' [^image-2017-08-17-21-46-45-806.png] or you can set a value like 'None' to make it appear all the time.
fields.summary: Add users mentioned in a comment to the list of involved users when using the smart mentions feature

fields.description:
Please reopen this issue, so that we can vote for it. When introducing JIRA in my organization, this is the question I get the most: Where can I get an overview of all my notifications in JIRA? (Swithing to Confluence is not an option!!)

As it is now it is too cumbersome to use the email as a working list. This should not be necessary when investing in a system like JIRA . It should be possible to have a notification overview, where it is possible to tick off which notifications not requiring any attention and action, so that you get a list of notifications where you need to take action.

We are evaluating the CRM system called Sales Force and they now how to do it! Please look their way!!
fields.summary: Add the Notification Inbox/Drawer to Jira.

fields.description:
Currently the default sort option in the Issues view is set to *Order by Priority*. This default cannot be changed.

For projects where Priority field is not used this sort order is not helpful at all. There should be a way to change it to another default, for example, Key or Updated.
fields.summary: Ability to change default sort option on the Issues page

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
If there are some obstruction on the mail queue service, it's not possible to refresh/restart the mail queue service without restarting JIRA application.

h3.  Suggestion
To have an option to restart the mail queue service.
fields.summary: Option to restart mail queue service without restarting JIRA application

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some users are referring [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-828788225.html] documentation for configuring their JIRA startup variables but still encounter some of the UTF character encoding problem after added the following parameter:
{code}
-Dfile.encoding=utf-8
{code}

Based on the [JIRA Application internationalisation and encoding troubleshooting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-application-internationalisation-and-encoding-troubleshooting-203394762.html], it seems like we need to add {{-Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8}} variable to fix it.

It would be great if we can have the {{-Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8}} variable in the https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-828788225.html
fields.summary: Update additional UTF parameter in the JIRA startup documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When configuring an application link, JIRA provides the value of the {{OAUTHCONSUMER}} table's {{consumername}} column to the remote application. This value is subsequently used in security dialogs, e.g. "Your Company JIRA would like read/write access to Bitbucket". 

However, the value here is not configurable anywhere in the UI. Updating the System Application Title in _JIRA Admin >> System >> General configuration_ does not update {{OAUTHCONSUMER.consumername}}, meaning that applinked apps will _always_ refer to linked JIRA instances as "Your Company JIRA" in the above security contexts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a new JIRA instance, and set a custom application title in _JIRA Admin >> System >> General configuration_
# Create a new application link to another app, e.g. Bitbucket Server
# Edit the application link title to another custom name
# Trigger the "Your Company JIRA would like read/write access to Bitbucket", e.g. by clicking on a smart commit link inside a JIRA issue to get Bitbucket to prompt the user to allow JIRA access.


h3. Expected Results
The name given to the remote app should match the one set in the Application Title in JIRA

h3. Actual Results
"Your Company JIRA" is always shown

h3.Workaround
Manually update the {{consumername}} column value in {{OAUTHCONSUMER}} table in JIRA, and restart JIRA to clear any memory-mapped values. Recreate the application link, and the security dialog will now display the correct name.
fields.summary: OAUTHCONSUMER.consumername is not updated to System application title

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the CSV export gives the issue Sprint by name. This is useful for reporting when users need to identify the sprints. However, to import sprint details using CSV, JIRA requires the Sprint ID instead as this uniquely identifies the Sprint in the instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add another column along with the Sprint Name for Sprint ID so that it this CSV is used for import, then this can be easily mapped.
fields.summary: CSV Export should add Sprint ID column to ease importing back into Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When migrating projects between instances - one populated source instance and newly created target instance, comment in the source instance's first ever created issue (ID 10000) shows up in a different project in the target instance's issue which has ID 10000.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create empty JIRA instance - we will call it "source":
 ## Create "Project A" with key "PA"
 ## Create "Project B" with key "PB"
 ## Create issues in this order:
 ### PB-1 (ID=10000)
 ### PB-2 (ID=10001)
 ### PA-1 (ID=10002)
 ## Comment in PB-1
 ## Link PB-2 to PA-1
 ## [Create backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/backing-up-data-802592964.html#Backingupdata-xml_backupUsingJIRA'sXMLbackuputility] "backup1.zip"
 # Create another empty JIRA instance - we will call it "target":
 ## Create "Project A" with key "PA"
 ## Create "Project B" with key "PB"
 ## Create issue PA-1 (ID=10000)
 ## [Import project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/restoring-a-project-from-backup-802592982.html#Restoringaprojectfrombackup-projectimportProjectImport] PB from backup "backup1.zip"

h3. Expected result

PB-1 in "target" instance has comment added in step 1.4.
h3. Actual result

PA-1 in "target" instance has comment added in step 1.4.
h2. Workaround without keeping cross-project issue links

There are multiple options:
 # Modify "source" instance backup to not contain issues with keys present in "target" instance.
 # Modify "source" instance backup to not contain issue links to issues outside of imported project.
 # Modify "source" instance backup in any other way to not meet the reproduction conditions from above.

All backup modifications can be done by:
 # Import full backup to an empty instance
 # Make modifications (delete issues/links/...)
 # Export backup

h2. Workaround without losing any issue link data
{panel:borderColor=#FFE7E7|bgColor=#FFE7E7}
(i) The steps below are to be tested very thoroughly before executing them in production and to be used at your own risk. 
{panel}
h5. I. Export issue links
 # Install the [ScriptRunner add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] to use it's JQL functions.
 # For each project:
 ## Run a JQL search with the query _project = PKEY and issueFunction in hasLinks()_
 ## In the results, only show columns:
 *** Key
 *** Summary
 *** Linked issues
 ## Export the current fields to CSV. If you end up with more than 1000 issues, refer to [Exporting a filter result containing more than 1000 issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/exporting-a-filter-result-containing-more-than-1000-issues-191500982.html].
 ## Open the CSV file in Excel and convert data to columns
 ## Remove the *Issue id* and *Parent id* columns from the Excel file and save again, this will change the delimited of the CSV file into *;*
 # Once you export issue links for all the migrated projects, delete all of them from the DB so they're not included in the XML backup.
Note that we're deleting all links but subtask and epic links:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM issuelink WHERE linktype NOT IN (SELECT id FROM issuelinktype WHERE linkname IN ('jira_subtask_link', 'Epic-Story Link'));
{code}

h5. II. XML backup and project import
 # Run an XML backup on the staging instance after deleting the issue links
 # Import the projects one by one to your target instance
 # Validate the comments and the attachments mapping is not broken

h5. III. Issue links import

For each project:
 # Make sure all custom issue link types from your source instance are present in your target instance
 # Refer to [Running the CSV file import wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/importing-data-from-csv-945111490.html#ImportingdatafromCSV-howRunningtheCSVfileimportwizard] to import the exported CSV with issue links.
 # In *Advanced*, change the delimiter to *;* and hit *Next*.
 # Select the project you're importing the links to and hit *Next*.[|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/3216050/3216050_external_import_2.png]
 # Map the fields and links accordingly. Be sure to tick all the checkboxes and hit *Next*.
 # Kick off the import and wait for it to finish
 # Validate the issue links are there as expected

h2. Why is this happening

This is because 2 things:
 * Import will treat PA-1 on both instances as the same issue. Issue link between PB-2 and PA-1 will be migrated.
 * There is a hack in {{IssueLinkPersisterHandler}} that uses collection of mapped issue IDs as mechanism to enforce issues reindexing. This is sometimes* overwriting issue ID mapping used by comment import to find newly created imported issues. The behaviour is there since 2008.

*when issue from imported project had originally the same ID as existing issue linked from "target" to some issue from imported project
h2. Notes

The bug will affect issue history as well as attachments
fields.summary: Migrating projects between instances can lead to wrong mapping of issue data

fields.description: Our team uses multiple Boards to have different views of the same data in a project. Sometimes there is a need to look at the data in a list view (for reporting or editing purposes). It would be nice if, when one clicks on the "Issues" button in the sidebar, it would open with the filter from the active board rather than going to the default "open issues" page.
fields.summary: Show Board Filter When Using the Sidebar Issues Button

fields.description:
h3. Summary

CSV > Current Fields export is omitting headers for some custom field types if there's no data for those fields in the JQL query. This only occurs with custom fields of type *Label*, *Checkbox*, or *Select List (multiple choices)*. For all other custom field types, the headers *are* included in the CSV export, even if there's no data included for these fields in the JQL query we're exporting from.
h3. Environment

Reproduced on JIRA 7.2.8 & 7.2.10 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add a custom field of type *Label*, *Checkbox* or *Select List (multiple choices)* to JIRA.
 * In *Issue Navigator*, in *List View*, add a column for the custom field. Do not populate this data for any issues.
 * *Export* > *CSV (Current fields)*
 * Observe that the custom field is omitted from the export
 * Repeat for any other custom field type except the three called out above.

h3. Expected Results

Though not populated, the custom field header should be exported in the CSV as it is with other custom field types. Additionally, it's expected that the columns exported in the CSV should match the columns visible in the UI.
h3. Actual Results

If no data for these three custom field types exists in the JQL results, headers are omitted from the export. If even a single issue has the field populated, the header *is* included in the export.
h3. Notes

Reports that rely on this export as a data source may break if expected headers aren't present.
h3. Workaround

No workaround has been identified.
fields.summary: Certain custom field types omitted from CSV export > Current Fields if not populated in JQL query

fields.description:
h3. +Scenario+

Each REST endpoint accepts a specific set of parameters for PUT requests. Only valid parameters are accepted for processing.

In some cases, due to a network requirement, an extra parameter is injected into a PUT request e.g. a Web Application Firewall might add a parameter to enhance XSRF protection. In such a case, JIRA will reject the request as a bad request (400 error) because it can't recognize the parameter.

Example: this error is thrown when attempting to edit a Version:
{code:java}
{"errorMessages":["Unrecognized field \"__ncforminfo\" (Class com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.version.VersionBean), not marked as ignorable\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@3afdb7ed; line: 1, column: 119] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.version.VersionBean[\"__ncforminfo\"])"]}{code}
h3. +Suggestion+

Add the ability to ignore unrecognized parameters for PUT (maybe POST as well) requests.
fields.summary: Ability to have JIRA REST API ignore unrecognized parameters
Do not interpret JQL in Basic searches
